description:
This is a year-long creative writing class, given as a collaboration of the Center for Programs in Contemporary Writing and the Institute of Contemporary Art. Students will be encouraged to develop correspondent methods of responding to the ICA's exhibitions. The class will involve monthly trips to New York City to attend concerts, museums and lectures. The students will have access to the most cutting--edge artists today via class visits and studio visits. English 165 will culminate in a publication co-sponsored by the ICA and CPCW. 

See English Department website at www.english.upenn.edu for a description of current offerings.
name: WRITING THROUGH CULT ART: Writing Through Culture and Art

values.name: WRITING THROUGH CULT ART: Writing Through Culture and Art
